| History                 = The National Force was a neo-fascist organization masterminded by [[Johan Fennhoff (Earth-616)|Doctor Faustus]].

Faustus obtained the suspended-animation bodies of the fourth [[William Burnside (Earth-616)|Captain America]] and his partner [[Jack Monroe (Earth-616)|Bucky]], replacement heroes of the 1950s. Faustus took control of their minds in an attempt to use them against the original [[Steven Rogers (Earth-616)|Captain America]], rechristening the McCarthy-era stand-in as "The Grand Director", leader of "The National Force".{{r|Captain America Vol 1 231}}

While working as a [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]] liaison with the [[New York City Police Department (Earth-616)|NYPD]], [[Sharon Carter (Earth-616)|Sharon Carter]] investigated and infiltrated the organization. During one of the National Force's battles with street criminals in [[Harlem]], the National Guard was brought in. Under the effects of a mind-altering gas, Sharon apparently activated a self-destruct device in her National Force uniform, giving the appearance of accidental self-immolation. Rogers was shown the event on videotape.{{r|Captain America Vol 1 232}}

After being defeated in battle by Cap and [[Matthew Murdock (Earth-616)|Daredevil]], the Grand Director also apparently committed suicide.{{r|Captain America Vol 1 234|236}}
